page.title: 09St. Mary's Church Brownsea
page.content: St. Mary's Anglican Church was erected by Colonel Petrie Waugh, when he bought the island in 1852. It is in the diocese of Salisbury. The church itself is made of Purbeck stone and has a small graveyard at the rear.The interior of the church is fairly detailed with a chancel, a vestry, a nave and a family pew under the Tower.The tower contains eight bells recast from the original four, and each one is named after a particular person connected with the island. The church has much fine workmanship. Two well-wrought screens divide the nave from the chancel.An unusual feature is the fireplace in the family pew, which has a Flemish picture over it.The church contains many works of art from Italy.
